DOC.brief_title: The Study Will Evaluate Efficacy AZD5423 Patients With Mild Asthma Challenged With Inhaled Allergen
DOC.criteria: 1860 year age Prebronchodilatory FEV1 ≥70 % predict normal allergic asthmatic history episodic wheeze Positive allergen induce early late airway bronchoconstriction show ≥ 20 % fall FEV1 early ≥ 15 % late response Positive skin prick test common aeroallergens Any clinically significant disease disorder Any clinically relevant abnormal find screen examination Smoker exsmoker stop smoke < 12 month prior study start Worsening asthma respiratory infection within 6 week visit 1 Allergenspecific immunotherapy within 6 month prior visit 1
DOC.keyword: Inhaled selective glucocorticoid receptor agonist ( iSEGRA )
